meanings.definition: To make a sharp clicking sound.
meanings.sent1: The old clock was snicking loudly in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the door snicking shut behind me as I entered the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was snicking the nuts together in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The scissors snicking through the paper sounded like a tiny drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The snicking of the typewriter keys filled the office with a rhythmic melody.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally snicked her finger while peeling the apple.
meanings.sent2: The barber carefully snicked the hair at the back of his neck.
meanings.sent3: The tailor snicked the fabric with precision to create a clean edge.
meanings.sent4: The sharp blade snicking through the cardboard effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: He snicked the pencil with a quick twist to sharpen the tip.

meanings.sent1: There was a tiny snicking on the edge of the table from the moving furniture.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a snicking on the surface of the mirror, probably from a previous accident.
meanings.sent3: The snicking on the apple skin made it look like a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: The snicking on the leather belt added a touch of character to its design.
meanings.sent5: He examined the snicking on the wood, wondering how it got there.
